info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 4:30PM EDT until June 16 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN VENANGO...NORTHEASTERN BUTLER AND NORTHWESTERN CLARION COUNTIES... At 430 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles west of Knox, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Knox, Seneca, Emlenton, Clintonville, St. Petersburg, Eau Claire, Kennerdell, Foxburg, Cherry Valley, and Cranberry Township. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
